channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Not all Republicans are embracing McConnell's vaccine push. Read what some had to say when asked this week
item.description: Nearly half of House Republicans still won't say publiclyâ€‹ whether they are vaccinated against Covid-19, even as new cases rise nationwide.

item.title: Chinese government rejects WHO plan for second phase of Covid-19 origins study
Inside an unexpected vaccination site in Las Vegas
item.description: CNN's Ed Lavandera visits a Las Vegas barbershop amidst rising cases of Covid-19 in Nevada. After several unvaccinated employees were infected, business owner Robert Taylor set up a vaccine site at his shop.

item.title: Fury in Congress as GOP hides Trump's crimes against the Constitution
item.description: It's gone beyond whitewashing history. Ex-President Donald Trump and his House Republican enablers are now spinning fantastical inversions to hide his crimes against the Constitution on January 6.

item.title: New audio recording from Trump interview
item.description: New audio recordings of an interview with former President Donald Trump for the book "I Alone Can Fix It" reveal how Trump felt about the then Vice President Mike Pence following the election.

item.title: Typhoon In-fa lashes Japan's southern islands as another tropical threat looms
item.description: Typhoon In-fa is bearing down on the southern Japanese islands and has its eye set on eastern China by next week. The storm could bring extremely heavy rainfall totals to millions in China and Taiwan.

item.title: NFL says coronavirus outbreaks among unvaccinated players may lead to forfeits this season
item.description: If a National Football League game cannot be rescheduled and is canceled due to a Covid-19 outbreak among unvaccinated players, that team will have to forfeit and will be credited with a loss, the NFL said in a league-wide memo obtained by CNN.

item.title: 'Like listening to Nixon drunk rambling': Cooper reacts to new Trump audio
item.description: Authors Carol Leonnig and Philip Rucker of "I Alone Can Fix It: Donald J. Trump's Catastrophic Final Year" share audio recordings of their interview with former President Donald Trump, where he shared his thoughts about the crowd during his January 6 speech before the deadly US Capitol insurrection.

item.title: Hospitalized Covid-19 patients are asking for the vaccine -- when it's too late, two health care workers say
item.description: As the Delta variant helps fuel a surge in Covid-19 hospitalizations in the US, unvaccinated patients are regretting their inoculation status, two health care workers say.

item.title: More than 150 people still missing in German floods unlikely to be found, officials fear
item.description: A week after severe flooding hit western Europe, devastating Germany, Belgium and the Netherlands, German officials said Thursday they fear the 158 people still missing there may not be found.

item.title: Eighteen states have enacted new laws that make it harder to vote
item.description: Eighteen states have enacted 30 new laws that make it harder to vote, according to a new tally by the liberal-leaning Brennan Center for Justice that tracks state activity through July 14.

item.title: Death toll rises as passengers recount horror of China subway floods
item.description: At least 33 people have died and eight remain missing in central China, as authorities ramp up rescue and recovery efforts following devastating floods that submerged entire neighborhoods, trapped passengers in subway cars, caused landslides and overwhelmed dams and rivers.

item.title: Fact check: Biden makes false claims about Covid-19, auto prices and other subjects at CNN town hall
item.description: President Joe Biden participated Wednesday in the second CNN town hall of his presidency, taking questions from anchor Don Lemon and local residents in Cincinnati.

item.title: Wildfires are getting so big they're sending smoke from Russia to the US
Tokyo 2020 Opening Ceremony mired in controversy as show director fired
item.description: The ambition is to make millions of television watchers around the world gasp and get their jaws dropping.

item.title: Olympics' economic losses will be 'enormous,' says Suntory CEO
item.description: Olympic sponsors have been left frustrated at the absence of spectators at the majority of Olympic events. Not only do they risk losing their returns on investment and high-profile tickets for the events for their executives and clients, some have expressed fears of a consumer backlash. Japanese companies had paid a record $3 billion dollars to sponsor the Games -- and many had paid out extra to extend contracts after the Games were postponed beyond 2020. CNN's Selina Wang speaks exclusively with Olympic sponsors and the CEO of Suntory, one of Japan's biggest beverage makers, who says the Games are losing their commercial value.

item.title: Massive internet outage: FedEx, Delta and McDonald's go down
item.description: A sweeping internet disruption on Thursday briefly took out a wide range of major corporate websites â€” from FedEx and Delta Airlines to HSBC and McDonald's.

item.title: Pelosi considering adding GOP Rep. Kinzinger to riot investigation committee
item.description: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi is considering naming GOP Rep. Adam Kinzinger to join the select committee investigating the deadly January 6 insurrection at the US Capitol.

item.title: Biden showed the Black community he gets it
item.description: "It's a simple basic proposition" President Joe Biden said Wednesday night during his CNN town hall, arguing that getting a Covid-19 vaccine was an easy decision.

item.title: How Covid-19 is ripping through one team at Tokyo 2020
item.description: Czech beach volleyball players MarkÃ©ta SlukovÃ¡-Nausch and Barbora Hermannova are coming to terms with being ruled out of the 2020 Tokyo Olympic Games as the European team grapples with a growing Covid-19 problem.

item.title: Australia's cockatoos taught each other to open trash cans for food, study finds
item.description: A few years ago, Australian scientist Richard Major took a video of a cockatoo in Sydney opening a closed trash bin lid with its beak and foot to access the gold mine of leftover food inside.

item.title: Daughter of detained man behind 'Hotel Rwanda' 'spied on' by Israeli software
item.description: The daughter of Paul Rusesabagina, a former hotelier who inspired the movie "Hotel Rwanda," has hit out at Rwandan authorities afterÂ a reportÂ emerged that she was on a list of people targeted by Pegasus, a military-grade spyware licensed by an Israeli company to governments.

item.title: Takeaways from President Biden's CNN town hall
item.description: President Joe Biden took questions from Ohioans on Wednesday at a CNN town hall, touching on his administration response to Covid-19, his work with Congress and many other issues.

item.title: Covid 'pingdemic' and Brexit mean food and gas shortages in parts of UK
item.description: A dramatic surge in Covid-19 cases is forcing hundreds of thousands of workers to stay home in Britain, causing shortages of food and gasoline and heaping stress on supply chains that were already strained by Brexit.

item.title: Judge forces US Capitol rioter to unlock laptop seized by FBI
item.description: A federal judge forced a US Capitol rioter to unlock his laptop Wednesday after prosecutors argued that it likely contained footage of the January 6 insurrection from his helmet-worn camera.

item.title: 'Anger, outrage': CNN reporter shares story about vaccine inequality
item.description: CNN's Larry Madowo shares his frustration and anger over losing his uncle to Covid-19 and says vaccine inequality around the world must end.

item.title: TikTok, Biden administration agree to drop litigation over Trump-era app store ban
item.description: TikTok and the US government agreed on Wednesday to drop a lawsuit challenging the Trump administration's attempt to ban the short-form video app from US app stores.

item.title: Indian tax officials raid newspaper that took on Narendra Modi over the pandemic
item.description: Tax authorities in India raided several offices of one of the world's biggest-selling newspapers on Thursday, a move journalists and leading opposition politicians described as an attack on press freedom.

item.title: GM is shutting down most of its pickup production for a week
item.description: General Motors will stop making most of its full-size pickup trucks for a week starting Monday. It's another sign that the auto industry continues to struggle with the year-long global computer chip shortage.

item.title: The pandemic has pushed children's mental health and access to care to a 'crisis point'
item.description: Throughout the Covid-19 pandemic, Bailey Lynn and her friends often talked about the toll the virus has taken. Still, the high school senior was surprised recently by the results of a survey she created to assess her classmates' mental health during the pandemic: Only a quarter who said they thought they needed a therapist had access to one.

item.title: 'Disgraceful': Liz Cheney fires back after McCarthy's move
item.description: Rep. Liz Cheney (R-WY) blasted House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy's (R-CA) decision to pull all Republicans from the select committee investigating the January 6 attack on the Capitol.

item.title: Pelosi exploded the myth of bipartisanship
item.description: Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi on Wednesday rejected Jim Jordan and Jim Banks, two Republican members who Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy had recommended for the select committee on the January 6 insurrection at the Capitol. She argued that those members, who not only voted to overturn the 2020 presidential election but also spread conspiracies about the vote-counting process, threatened "the integrity of the investigation." McCarthy responded by pulling all of his people from the committee. When the committee holds a hearing next week (a spokesman told CNN it will not be delayed), it will contain no allies of former President Donald Trump.

item.title: Mexico thrashes France and Spain held as men's football competition kicks off at Tokyo 2020
item.description: Mexico beat France 4-1 on Wednesday as the men's football tournament kicked off at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Don Lemon cracks up at Biden's 'Hail to the Chief' story
item.description: President Joe Biden cracked a joke while explaining to CNN's Don Lemon how he is adjusting to life at the White House, saying the first time he heard "Hail to the Chief" being played for him it left him wondering "where's he at?"

item.title: A far-right extremist killed 77 people in Norway. A decade on, 'the hatred is still out there'
item.description: Ten years ago, Norwegian far-right extremist Anders Behring Brevik killed 77 people, many of them teenagers, in a bomb attack and gun rampage. The July 22 attacks left Norway, a small, close-knit Nordic country, stunned and grieving.

item.title: Chimpanzees have been spotted attacking and killing gorillas in the wild for the first time
item.description: Chimpanzees' lethal attacks on gorillas in the wild have been observed for the first time, a team of researchers has said.

item.title: How skateboarding went mainstream in Japan
item.description: As skateboarding makes its Olympic debut in Tokyo, Japan's home team is gunning for gold. CNN's Blake Essig speaks with the Osaka Daggers, a cutting-edge street skateboarding crew, to trace the country's skateboarding origins and explores how it's gaining in popularity as it prepares to make a splash at the Summer Games.

item.title: Teen charged after allegedly changing yearbook to include Hitler quote
item.description: A Connecticut teenager has been charged with two counts of third-degree computer crimes after he allegedly changed two yearbook entries to include a quote from Adolf Hitler and a reference to the Boston Marathon bomber, according to an arrest log from the Glastonbury Police Department.

item.title: 'This is way beyond collaborative': Young leaders see their feedback reflected in Biden's plans
item.description: When Joe Biden campaigned for the presidency, he called himself a bridge to a new generation of leaders in the Democratic Party. While some frustrations remain, young leaders are saying the President Biden's administration is making good progress on Candidate Biden's pledge.

item.title: 'The stuff of nightmares': Breaking down Nigeria's kidnapping epidemic
item.description: CNN's Zain Asher explores the reasons why Nigeria is suffering through a wave of kidnappings.

item.title: Iconic moments from Summer Olympics history
item.description: The Summer Olympics have provided us with many unforgettable moments over the years.

item.title: Megan Fox quit drinking years ago after getting belligerent at the Golden Globes
item.description: Megan Fox may not remember a great deal from the 2009 Golden Globe Awards, but she does know she "got in a lot of trouble" for things she said on the red carpet while tipsy.

item.title: Ryan Reynolds gets real about anxiety
item.description: Canadian actor Ryan Reynolds got honest this week about his mental health and the impact that anxiety has had on his life and work.

item.title: Ice T reacts to the hoopla over his 'twin' daughter
item.description: A photo of Ice T's look-alike 5-year-old daughter Chanel went viral and, according to him, it yielded some nice results.

item.title: Europe's central bank could print another $1 trillion
item.description: We have a thing around here for big numbers. The more zeros the better.

item.title: Lorde got so drunk with Seth Meyers she needed an IV drip
item.description: Lorde got her drink on with Seth Meyers in the return of the drinking game on "Late Night with Seth Meyers."

item.title: Defending Olympic champion Brazil defeats Germany in rematch of 2016 men's football final
item.description: Defending Olympic champion Brazil defeated Germany on Thursday in what was a rematch of the 2016 Rio men's football final.

item.title: The Rolling Stones announce rescheduled tour dates
item.description: After a couple stops, The Rolling Stones' "No Filter" tour is now set to go on.

item.title: Astronomers spy first moon-forming disk around an exoplanet
item.description: For the first time, astronomers have found a disk around a Jupiter-like planet outside of our solar system -- the kind of disk where moons could actively be forming.

item.title: 'Less thinking' and other tips on stress from an Olympian
item.description: Armand "Mondo" Duplantis holds the world record in pole vault and he's sharing his tips on managing stress in competition to help the rest of us manage stress in everyday life.
